column1: “The  claim  of  the  petitioner  is  not  based  on  any  legal  document,  neither  has  he
claimed that he has a valid lease of that or that it had been in any way alienated to
him by way of a legal transfer, but he was simply in occupation as a trespasser.”

I
n considering the above judgements, I find that after conceding that he is in occupation of
State land, the Petitioner has failed to produce any valid document that authorizes him to

C
onsidering all the above facts, I am of the opinion that the Petitioner has failed to establish
a prima facie case. Accordingly, for the aforementioned reasons this Court is not inclined
to issue formal notice on the Respondents and we proceed to dismiss this Application.
Judge of the Court of Appeal
Judge of the Court of Appeal
